column4: Roasted: Tried going into the app pakages and searching for text to speech?
Sorry ROasted, I used to have one but can't for the life of me remember the name
What about searching for speech recognition?

I keep getting this error when trying to mount my partition: "THe superblock could not be read or does not describe a correct ext2 filesystem. If the device is valid and really contains an ext2 filesystem, then the superblock is corrupt, and you might try running e2fsck with an alternate superblock: e2fsck -b 8193 <device>"
Would you mind me asking, maybe someone has already asked, what kind of troubleshooting you have done?
just want to confirm, this partition is your normal internal hard drive?
I am   assuming you are using ext3 file system here?
Was there any error messages during the install ?
sorry for asking like mad, but I am trying to get a handle of the issue here....
so the install was fine, huh?......hmmmm
You know what? erickj92? I think there is a problem with even recognising that a partition exists, let alone its file system
It may be worth mentioning that the Windows partition on the same HDD mounts fine
well it is not window's fault, that's for sure
Would you recomend formatting said partition and re-installing Linux as a definate measure?
sounds like grub problem
sigh, well, might have to....if yo want to redce the dabbling around
What I'd honestly like to do is get rid of Linux on this computer, because i want to sell it. How would I go about getting rid of LInux and sitll being able to boot Windows?
wooooo, so your boot loader is on the linux partition, not on the windows partition?
My boot loader is on a flash drive apparently. Right now I don't even have a boot loader. Thus the mess I am currently in
mate, that is not quite my level of expertise. I think you better find someone who can do this kind of stuff
no help at all....:P
have a look at this : http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms901837.aspx
that is the windows bootloader creation method, dirfectly from microsoft
